channel.title: Hosting Issues (Rep++)
channel.description: ******* Closed, no one can seem to help me and after all this time it is not even worth it anymore. Thanks to those who tried. *******

item.title: Hosting Issues (Rep++)
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

BLAH I have been trying to do this for so long. I have been working on this for fucking ever and it is this one step that is holding me back. Does anyone have a fucking Linksys Cisco router? I have looked up over 20 port forwarding tutorials, offered rep, had my IT department at school try and help me o.O It is driving me crazy.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues (Rep++)
item.dc:creator: @sex-scape_owner sex-scape owner
item.description:
@sex-scape_owner wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:12, topic:415087”][quote author=sex-scape owner link=topic=517046.msg3755280#msg3755280 date=1316388586]

Your keeping the DUC open while your run your server right?

He is not required to, as the DUC only keeps checking for his IP to see if it has changed. His IP will only change every month or so depending on his ISP.

@op Port forwarding has failed, and you probably have a firewall on the computer you are hosting it off of.

Really? Well I don’t use port forwarding, I only heard you had to.

that makes now sense ;3 if you dont use pf then you cant get your sever online simple as
[/quote]
Lol yeah my server can go online, I use Hamachi:P I can’t port forward because I don’t have the passwords and stuff for my router.[/quote]

meh i despise hamachi.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

tyb97:

Your keeping the DUC open while your run your server right?

He is not required to, as the DUC only keeps checking for his IP to see if it has changed. His IP will only change every month or so depending on his ISP.

@op Port forwarding has failed, and you probably have a firewall on the computer you are hosting it off of.

item.title: Hosting Issues (Rep++)
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

[quote=“Ddragonimp, post:6, topic:415087”][quote author=nolan2131 link=topic=517046.msg3755095#msg3755095 date=1316377068]
I would believe that in my case except this is the 3rd time in like 2 months that I have posted with this issue Maybe my router is randomly not letting me pf for like months but IDK. I will try restarting.
[/quote]

You probaly have Dynamic Ip Address and or ICMB ping blocking enabled… ICMB? think thats what its called… I portforwarded correctly but people couldnt ping me because i was blocking pings… Took me 3 days to figure out… I suggest taking a look at that.[/quote]

People have always hosted for me, so you are speaking in binary code there

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues (Rep++)
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Your keeping the DUC open while your run your server right?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Issues (Rep++)
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

nolan2131:

I would believe that in my case except this is the 3rd time in like 2 months that I have posted with this issue Maybe my router is randomly not letting me pf for like months but IDK. I will try restarting.

You probaly have Dynamic Ip Address and or ICMB ping blocking enabled… ICMB? think thats what its called… I portforwarded correctly but people couldnt ping me because i was blocking pings… Took me 3 days to figure out… I suggest taking a look at that.

Read full topic
